name: centipede_damascus
text: That is one brave potato sliver.

name: mnemon
text: I appreciate the simplicity of an otter and his fry.

name: zem
text: I never noticed before but Philippe looks pretty weird rolled on his side.

name: biddlebubbly
text: He's basically just a popsicle.

name: alejandroadam
text: otterpop

name: theguitarhero
text: A, dare I say, freezepop.

name: ford
text: Attercop!

name: shortside40
text: Tomnoddy

name: soticoto
text: Lontra canadensis.

name: blitztrug
text: haha! you are british!

name: dezufnocosem
text: such innocence such beauty that is, phillipe and the french fry

name: abe
text: The happiest Achewood moment.

name: retinarow
text: oh my god i accidentally lamed you for your wonderful comment i am so sorry.

name: mortshire
text: that french fry can do ANYTHING.

name: chaesar
text: The last frame is a t-shirt that needs to be made.

name: jamers
text: I'd buy it before the fry hit the ground.

name: jesler729
text: Maybe on the back it could have Philippe pushing the French Fry in the roller skate.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: like, down in the corner of the back? the shirts with designs on the rear of the neck are ridiculously lame.

name: jamers
text: This is my favorite Philippe strip.

name: tinhand
text: Phillippe looks weird anyhow. What's weirder though, surely, is that a potato sliver can talk in the first place (unless this is in Phillipes imagination, kids do this sort of thing)

name: shoinan
text: Schulz would be proud.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: you see Schulz, I see Watterson

name: shoinan
text:
Really? Phillipe seems like the antithesis of Calvin to me. The way the french fry speaks is just like Woodstock!

Having said that I think Bill would be mighty proud of Achewood too. I wonder if Onstad is a C&H fan?

name: godfatherofsouls
text: Very different children yes, and the fry does speak in those little shrieklines, but the arc seems to me to be about philippe's imagination rather than a talking french fry. Calvin's a clever, crafty sometimes vicious boy who as such relates to a stuffed tiger. Philippe on the other hand has a blast conversing with a stick of fried starch.

name: shoinan
text: Fair enough, there are resemblances to Calvin in terms of a little boy with imagination. But in terms of style I think this strip is directly referencing those strips with Snoopy and Woodstock. I may be wrong though, it's been a while since I read Peanuts.

name: hamscout
text:
I'd vote Watterson, just for the whimsy/cuteness, and for the times he would have an elaborate setting with just a simple joy, simply stated.
...from the mouths of babes...
...or otters...
...or french fries...

name: spectre
text: Alt text: "Things are ominously cute with french fry around." It's . . . a harbinger of DOOM, of DEATH!

name: evolume
text: French Fry! Watch out for swooping crows!

name: satellitetv
text: I love that panel 5 is french fry speak for "I'm brave enough!"

name: sargasm
text: These are really cute until you consider the possibility that he is just hallucinating all of it.

name: cailetshadow
text: When a child tells you he has an imaginary friend, do you get a grave expression on your face and cut off all communication forever?

name: sargasm
text: Imaginary friends are fine, as long as the kid knows they are imaginary.  Believing that french fries are completely alive is a little Mark David Chapman, if you know what I mean.

name: aurorasbored
text: Oh Jesus. I think I'll stop reading now, for nothing will achieve the pathos.

name: hcaz
text:
I was going to rag all over this strip, and then I saw the last page and I felt myself get happier.

Lovely.

name: youngsoulrebel
text: I love these Phillipe strips.  So gentile and playful.

name: howl
text: non-Jewish?

name: baryonyx
text: I have a theory that after graduating from Calvin & Hobbes the natural progression leads you then to Achewood.

name: jamers
text: I agree with this theory, and pronounce it law.

name: charchar
text: As a short girl with tall friends, this comic opens up an entire world of possibilities for me.  The poor fry really needs a cape, though.

name: coco
text: The best thing is that you know that just before, they were talking about what the clouds looked like . . . all lying in a field, practically holding hands . . ,

name: snowman
text: Philippe kills me, every time.

name: hairymoonstone
text: I can't work out if it's all in the stuffed one's head. It makes me hope not :S

name: deptford
text: Great strip. One thing, though: I see no reason why its title shouldn't be "French Fly"

name: twntysevn27
text: I don't know what I enjoy more; Happy Philippe, or traumatized Philippe.

name: norsef
text: A comment left by norsef was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by cuddlefish, Cracklewater, logic)

name: tekende
text: No.

name: kikineko
text: This is a nice break for Philippe to be away from the sociopaths in the household.

name: tekende
text: Is it?

name: kikineko
text: This is a nice break for Philippe to be away from the sociopaths in the household.

name: tekende
text: I guess you're pretty sure of that, then.

name: greenkoolayd
text: saddest thing?  if a bird had flown down and stolen the fry.
